intro: Camellia seiobo, commonly known as the Japanese camellia, is a flowering plant native to Japan and southern Korea. It is a member of the Theaceae family and is characterized by its showy, double flowers that range in color from red to pink and white. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. Camellia seiobo thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
